title: Book Review: House of God
summary:
Key ideas:
- "The House of God" is a book about medical internship which accentuates the reality of medical professionals.
- The story revolves around an obvious author-insert character, Roy Basch MD, who starts his internship year at a hospital called the House of God.
- Medical intervention can only make patients worse in the fictional world of "The House of God".
- The primary form of medical treatment in the novel is the TURF – the excuse to get a patient out of your care and on to somebody else’s.
- The House of God does a weird form of figure-ground inversion of medicine by inverting commonly held assumptions.
- House of God is a book that portrays medicine as a chaotic and often inhumane system
- The book has had an impact in helping to change the medical education system, reduce patient falls, and encourage more empathy and communication skills among doctors
- The book's characters struggle to balance their human compassion with the demands of the medical system

Key learnings:
- Medicine is magical realist and life-and-death stakes are an everyday reality.
- Medical intervention can only make patients worse in some cases.
- The primary form of medical treatment in the novel is the TURF.
- The courage to speak the truth can have a powerful impact in challenging oppressive systems
- Medical practices and training have improved since the book was written, but there is still room for improvement
- Psychoanalysis is a key framework for understanding the psychological toll of medical training and practice

Key questions:
- What are the laws of the House of God?
- Is it ethical for Dr. Basch to prevent his patients from getting any treatment?
- What is the Black Crow?
- How can medical training and practice be reformed to prioritize empathy, compassion, and patient-centered care?
- What role do medical professionals have in advocating for better healthcare policies and systems?
- How can literature and storytelling help us better understand and critique oppressive systems?
